snippet: An Israeli committee’s approval of about 500 new apartments for settlers in Ramat Shlomo on Monday brought condemnation from the Obama administration.
abstract: Israeli committee approves about 500 new apartments in ultra-Orthodox Jewish neighborhood in East Jerusalem, prompting condemnation from Obama administration; neighborhood has become prime symbol of Israel's conflict with Palestinians and its diplomatic confrontations with Washington and rest of the world.

byline.contributor: Michael Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An Israeli committee’s approval of about 500 new apartments for settlers in Ramat Shlomo on Monday brought condemnation from the Obama administration.

headline.main: For a Packed Part of Jerusalem, Expansion Plans Have Built Mostly Outrage
headline.print_headline: For a Packed Part of Jerusalem, Expansion Plans Have Built Mostly Outrage
